extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.cassandra.PutCassandraQL
extension.description: Execute provided Cassandra Query Language (CQL) statement on a Cassandra 1.x, 2.x, or 3.0.x cluster. The content of an incoming FlowFile is expected to be the CQL command to execute. The CQL command may use the ? to escape parameters. In this case, the parameters to use must exist as FlowFile attributes with the naming convention cql.args.N.type and cql.args.N.value, where N is a positive integer. The cql.args.N.type is expected to be a lowercase string indicating the Cassandra type.

property.name: cassandra-connection-provider
property.description: Specifies the Cassandra connection providing controller service to be used to connect to Cassandra cluster.

property.name: Cassandra Contact Points
property.description: Contact points are addresses of Cassandra nodes. The list of contact points should be comma-separated and in hostname:port format. Example node1:port,node2:port,.... The default client port for Cassandra is 9042, but the port(s) must be explicitly specified.

property.name: Keyspace
property.description: The Cassandra Keyspace to connect to. If no keyspace is specified, the query will need to include the keyspace name before any table reference, in case of 'query' native processors or if the processor exposes the 'Table' property, the keyspace name has to be provided with the table name in the form of <KEYSPACE>.<TABLE>

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL connections.

property.name: Client Auth
property.description: Client authentication policy when connecting to secure (TLS/SSL) cluster. Possible values are REQUIRED, WANT, NONE. This property is only used when an SSL Context has been defined and enabled.

property.name: Username
property.description: Username to access the Cassandra cluster

property.name: Password
property.description: Password to access the Cassandra cluster

property.name: Consistency Level
property.description: The strategy for how many replicas must respond before results are returned.

property.name: Compression Type
property.description: Enable compression at transport-level requests and responses

property.name: Character Set
property.description: Specifies the character set of the record data.

property.name: Max Wait Time
property.description: The maximum amount of time allowed for a running CQL select query. Must be of format <duration> <TimeUnit> where <duration> is a non-negative integer and TimeUnit is a supported Time Unit, such as: nanos, millis, secs, mins, hrs, days. A value of zero means there is no limit.

property.name: putcql-stmt-cache-size
property.description: The maximum number of CQL Prepared Statements to cache. This can improve performance if many incoming flow files have the same CQL statement with different values for the parameters. If this property is set to zero, the cache is effectively disabled.

relationship.name: retry
relationship.description: A FlowFile is transferred to this relationship if the operation cannot be completed but attempting it again may succeed.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: A FlowFile is transferred to this relationship if the operation completed successfully.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: A FlowFile is transferred to this relationship if the operation failed.

readsAttribute.name: cql.args.N.type
readsAttribute.description: Incoming FlowFiles are expected to be parameterized CQL statements. The type of each parameter is specified as a lowercase string corresponding to the Cassandra data type (text, int, boolean, e.g.). In the case of collections, the primitive type(s) of the elements in the collection should be comma-delimited, follow the collection type, and be enclosed in angle brackets (< and >), for example set<text> or map<timestamp, int>.

readsAttribute.name: cql.args.N.value
readsAttribute.description: Incoming FlowFiles are expected to be parameterized CQL statements. The value of the parameters are specified as cql.args.1.value, cql.args.2.value, cql.args.3.value, and so on. The type of the cql.args.1.value parameter is specified by the cql.args.1.type attribute.

systemResourceConsideration.description: An instance of this component can cause high usage of this system resource. Multiple instances or high concurrency settings may result a degradation of performance.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.cassandra.PutCassandraRecord
extension.description: This is a record aware processor that reads the content of the incoming FlowFile as individual records using the configured 'Record Reader' and writes them to Apache Cassandra using native protocol version 3 or higher.

property.name: cassandra-connection-provider
property.description: Specifies the Cassandra connection providing controller service to be used to connect to Cassandra cluster.

property.name: Cassandra Contact Points
property.description: Contact points are addresses of Cassandra nodes. The list of contact points should be comma-separated and in hostname:port format. Example node1:port,node2:port,.... The default client port for Cassandra is 9042, but the port(s) must be explicitly specified.

property.name: Keyspace
property.description: The Cassandra Keyspace to connect to. If no keyspace is specified, the query will need to include the keyspace name before any table reference, in case of 'query' native processors or if the processor exposes the 'Table' property, the keyspace name has to be provided with the table name in the form of <KEYSPACE>.<TABLE>

property.name: put-cassandra-record-table
property.description: The name of the Cassandra table to which the records have to be written.

property.name: put-cassandra-record-statement-type
property.description: Specifies the type of CQL Statement to generate.

allowableValue.description: The value of the cql.statement.type Attribute will be used to determine which type of statement (UPDATE, INSERT) will be generated and executed

property.name: put-cassandra-record-update-keys
property.description: A comma-separated list of column names that uniquely identifies a row in the database for UPDATE statements. If the Statement Type is UPDATE and this property is not set, the conversion to CQL will fail. This property is ignored if the Statement Type is not UPDATE.

property.name: put-cassandra-record-update-method
property.description: Specifies the method to use to SET the values. This property is used if the Statement Type is UPDATE and ignored otherwise.

allowableValue.description: Use an increment operation (+=) for the Update statement.
Use a decrement operation (-=) for the Update statement.
Use a set operation (=) for the Update statement.
The value of the cql.update.method Attribute will be used to determine which operation (Set, Increment, Decrement) will be used to generate and execute the Update statement.

property.name: Client Auth
property.description: Client authentication policy when connecting to secure (TLS/SSL) cluster. Possible values are REQUIRED, WANT, NONE. This property is only used when an SSL Context has been defined and enabled.

property.name: Username
property.description: Username to access the Cassandra cluster

property.name: Password
property.description: Password to access the Cassandra cluster

property.name: put-cassandra-record-reader
property.description: Specifies the type of Record Reader controller service to use for parsing the incoming data and determining the schema

property.name: put-cassandra-record-batch-size
property.description: Specifies the number of 'Insert statements' to be grouped together to execute as a batch (BatchStatement)

property.name: Consistency Level
property.description: The strategy for how many replicas must respond before results are returned.

property.name: put-cassandra-record-batch-statement-type
property.description: Specifies the type of 'Batch Statement' to be used.

allowableValue.description: The value of the cql.batch.statement.type Attribute will be used to determine which type of batch statement (LOGGED, UNLOGGED or COUNTER) will be used to generate and execute the Update statement.

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL connections.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: A FlowFile is transferred to this relationship if the operation completed successfully.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: A FlowFile is transferred to this relationship if the operation failed.

readsAttribute.name: cql.statement.type
readsAttribute.description: If 'Use cql.statement.type Attribute' is selected for the Statement Type property, the value of the cql.statement.type Attribute will be used to determine which type of statement (UPDATE, INSERT) will be generated and executed

readsAttribute.name: cql.update.method
readsAttribute.description: If 'Use cql.update.method Attribute' is selected for the Update Method property, the value of the cql.update.method Attribute will be used to determine which operation (Set, Increment, Decrement) will be used to generate and execute the Update statement. Ignored if the Statement Type property is not set to UPDATE

readsAttribute.name: cql.batch.statement.type
readsAttribute.description: If 'Use cql.batch.statement.type Attribute' is selected for the Batch Statement Type property, the value of the cql.batch.statement.type Attribute will be used to determine which type of batch statement (LOGGED, UNLOGGED, COUNTER) will be generated and executed

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.cassandra.QueryCassandra
extension.description: Execute provided Cassandra Query Language (CQL) select query on a Cassandra 1.x, 2.x, or 3.0.x cluster. Query result may be converted to Avro or JSON format. Streaming is used so arbitrarily large result sets are supported. This processor can be scheduled to run on a timer, or cron expression, using the standard scheduling methods, or it can be triggered by an incoming FlowFile. If it is triggered by an incoming FlowFile, then attributes of that FlowFile will be available when evaluating the select query. FlowFile attribute 'executecql.row.count' indicates how many rows were selected.

property.name: cassandra-connection-provider
property.description: Specifies the Cassandra connection providing controller service to be used to connect to Cassandra cluster.

property.name: Cassandra Contact Points
property.description: Contact points are addresses of Cassandra nodes. The list of contact points should be comma-separated and in hostname:port format. Example node1:port,node2:port,.... The default client port for Cassandra is 9042, but the port(s) must be explicitly specified.

property.name: Keyspace
property.description: The Cassandra Keyspace to connect to. If no keyspace is specified, the query will need to include the keyspace name before any table reference, in case of 'query' native processors or if the processor exposes the 'Table' property, the keyspace name has to be provided with the table name in the form of <KEYSPACE>.<TABLE>

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL connections.

property.name: Client Auth
property.description: Client authentication policy when connecting to secure (TLS/SSL) cluster. Possible values are REQUIRED, WANT, NONE. This property is only used when an SSL Context has been defined and enabled.

property.name: Username
property.description: Username to access the Cassandra cluster

property.name: Password
property.description: Password to access the Cassandra cluster

property.name: Consistency Level
property.description: The strategy for how many replicas must respond before results are returned.

property.name: Compression Type
property.description: Enable compression at transport-level requests and responses

property.name: Character Set
property.description: Specifies the character set of the record data.

property.name: CQL select query
property.description: CQL select query

property.name: Max Wait Time
property.description: The maximum amount of time allowed for a running CQL select query. Must be of format <duration> <TimeUnit> where <duration> is a non-negative integer and TimeUnit is a supported Time Unit, such as: nanos, millis, secs, mins, hrs, days. A value of zero means there is no limit.

property.name: Fetch size
property.description: The number of result rows to be fetched from the result set at a time. Zero is the default and means there is no limit.

property.name: Max Rows Per Flow File
property.description: The maximum number of result rows that will be included in a single FlowFile. This will allow you to break up very large result sets into multiple FlowFiles. If the value specified is zero, then all rows are returned in a single FlowFile.

property.name: qdbt-output-batch-size
property.description: The number of output FlowFiles to queue before committing the process session. When set to zero, the session will be committed when all result set rows have been processed and the output FlowFiles are ready for transfer to the downstream relationship. For large result sets, this can cause a large burst of FlowFiles to be transferred at the end of processor execution. If this property is set, then when the specified number of FlowFiles are ready for transfer, then the session will be committed, thus releasing the FlowFiles to the downstream relationship. NOTE: The maxvalue.* and fragment.count attributes will not be set on FlowFiles when this property is set.

property.name: Output Format
property.description: The format to which the result rows will be converted. If JSON is selected, the output will contain an object with field 'results' containing an array of result rows. Each row in the array is a map of the named column to its value. For example: { "results": [{"userid":1, "name":"Joe Smith"}]}

property.name: timestamp-format-pattern
property.displayName: Timestamp Format Pattern for JSON output
property.description: Pattern to use when converting timestamp fields to JSON. Note: the formatted timestamp will be in UTC timezone.

relationship.name: retry
relationship.description: A FlowFile is transferred to this relationship if the operation cannot be completed but attempting it again may succeed.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: A FlowFile is transferred to this relationship if the operation completed successfully.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: A FlowFile is transferred to this relationship if the operation failed.

writesAttribute.name: executecql.row.count
writesAttribute.description: The number of rows returned by the CQL query

writesAttribute.name: fragment.identifier
writesAttribute.description: If 'Max Rows Per Flow File' is set then all FlowFiles from the same query result set will have the same value for the fragment.identifier attribute. This can then be used to correlate the results.

writesAttribute.name: fragment.count
writesAttribute.description: If 'Max Rows Per Flow File' is set then this is the total number of FlowFiles produced by a single ResultSet. This can be used in conjunction with the fragment.identifier attribute in order to know how many FlowFiles belonged to the same incoming ResultSet. If Output Batch Size is set, then this attribute will not be populated.

writesAttribute.name: fragment.index
writesAttribute.description: If 'Max Rows Per Flow File' is set then the position of this FlowFile in the list of outgoing FlowFiles that were all derived from the same result set FlowFile. This can be used in conjunction with the fragment.identifier attribute to know which FlowFiles originated from the same query result set and in what order FlowFiles were produced
